snippet: As high-speed Internet and better cellphone reception reach a remote corner of Vermont where a school offers a semester on a farm for high school students, questions are arising about regulating use.
abstract: Mountain School in rural Vermont, which offers high school juniors a semester on a farm to immerse themselves in nature, is facing test of how to regulate use of smartphones and other devices as access to high-speed internet and better cellphone reception infiltrates area; concern is that technology will serve as distraction for 21st-century teenagers, who are there to engage with rural setting and with one another.
lead_paragraph: As high-speed Internet and better cellphone reception reach a remote corner of Vermont where a school offers a semester on a farm for high school students, questions are arising about regulating use.

headline.seo: Vermont School Cut Off From Technology Faces Its Intrusion
